text: Hello with the new requirements all color related fields should be moved from content to style tab. How we can do the migration in the code in order not to break any functionality in existing installations? Do you have a recommended migration path? Thanks in advance!

Hello <@U01TGDDULCR>

You find in the color field in module.html code of the content.

Find out where use in the content's all color field code. Then move the content all field to the style tab then use the snippet of the style tab color field.

After replace content field with style tab field in code.

I hope it can help you without any functionality break.

So there is an official update regarding this topic? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Create-a-path-to-make-it-possible-to-migrate-existing-fields-to/idi-p/450311?_ga=2.121670536.2081261834.1683643921-613095766.1683643327&_gl=1*xfofgm*_ga*NjEzMDk1NzY2LjE2ODM2NDMzMjc.*_ga_LXTM6CQ0XK*MTY4MzcwODU4Ny4yLjEuMTY4MzcwOTc0NS4wLjAuMA|https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Create-a-path-to-make-it-possible-to-mig[â€¦]*_ga_LXTM6CQ0XK*MTY4MzcwODU4Ny4yLjEuMTY4MzcwOTc0NS4wLjAuMA>

<@U0133LK9GP9> I'm trying to makes changes to our theme in the marketplace to pass all new requirements. This is the only error i cannot handle without breaking the module for existing users that already use the theme.

Aliases should be what you're looking for
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/marketplace-guidelines/module-requirements#aliases>
Great, exactly what i was looking for <@U01AS49TB0T> . Thank you for updating also the article to avoid any further confusion!
